ceilingRelativePoint.description: usually, the ceiling portal's relative point is the centre of the room. However, in cases where multi-rooms are stitched together into a single room, this relationship is broken. Ie, bookworld28/ bookworld29. In this case, this point is used instead

height.description: custom room height that can be set per-room in blocks. If not set, the default room height is used. Only a few of the original game rooms need this to make the transition to the next room above work better. Can be used to fine-tune the point in a jump where the room above loads.

direction.description: this wall would normally be found on the (invisible) towards side of the room
this wall would normally be found/rendered on the away side of the room

tiles.description: the tiles to show - the length of this array also determines the size of the wall

direction.description: this wall would normally be found/rendered on the left side of the room

tiles.description: the tiles to show - the length of this array also determines the size of the wall

toDoor.description: the id of the door in the destination room. This usually does not need to be given since the game can choose the door facing the right way from the destination room. only give this if there are multiple doors in the same direction between the two rooms

was.description: it is the bubbles that play the sound when something is fading out, not the item itself. This property helps us know which sound to play

emits.description: what does this emitter emit? Could be (potentially) any free item

maximum.description: how many should this emitter emit? Null for no limit

type.description: this switch targets the redux store
this switch targets items in the room

floorType.description: the room has no floor, but it is included to draw the floor edge

items.description: by keying each item with an id, it makes the diffing easier since the array is no longer position-dependent

nonContiguousRelationship.description: for rooms that are shown on the same map even though they don't have any physical connection

gridOffset.description: the other room needs to have the opposite (* -1) of this

gridPosition.description: the grid position (on the map) of this sub-room

physicalPosition.description: where the sub-room actually starts and ends on the map (so we can work out which sub-room items are in)

subRooms.description: subRooms are used for the map for rooms which were modelled as multiple rooms in the original game
